website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a natural detergent that’s suitable for hard water, effortlessly handles set-in stains, and eradicates odors, this is a solid choice.
pros: Free of harsh chemicals and irritants
Utilizes cloth diaper-friendly enzymes to break down proteins
Exceptionally effective at tackling stubborn stains and removing odors
The addition of tea tree oil helps fight bacterial growth and lends it a pleasant natural fragrance
cons: Not everyone is a fan of the tea tree scent

customer_reviews.title: HARSH ON SKIN
customer_reviews.text: I changed my wash routine to this detergent for my cloth diapers. Followed directions with the extra rinse. Even with addig another cold wash after the cycle was complete without detergent to try to give it an extra extra rinse. I am very unhappy with this product. Even if you child doesn’t break out in rash. Clearly there is something in this platinum detergent that is in-fact a harsh chemical. Would not recommend! Very disappointed. 😞
customer_reviews.author: L Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well but wont keep using
customer_reviews.text: We have been using rockin green lavender mint for 3 years now and love it for our cloth diapers so when they came out with the diaper formula we decided to try it. Unfortunately, we wont keep using it and we will go back to the lavender mint formula. This diaper formula, while it does clean well and gets even the tough stains out, has a strong smell that we don't care for. In addition, ever since we started using this diaper formula our daughter had been getting really bad rashes. She never got rashes with the other formula. We are going to save this for when we need stain removal and switch back.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal2004

customer_reviews.title: Gets breastmilk poop stains out!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Rockin Green for all of our clothes and diapers for 2 years now. I’ve always been frustrated at Diaper smells and stains despite stripping them. This new blend is amazing and if I wash the diapers fairly quickly, it even gets breastmilk poop out. I don’t know what is different about this blend than the other Rockin Green but I am impressed and will keep buying!
customer_reviews.author: Roanie1012

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this detergent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a few sets of preowned cloth diapers on Ebay and they were STINKY when I opened the package. I washed the diapers and inserts according to the directions on the back of the package for deep cleaning and they came out smelling only of simple cotton. I am in love with this detergent. I live in Mexico, so I will be happily transporting this product back home in my luggage when I come to visit the US. I hope one day soon it will be available to ship to my residence in Mexico.
customer_reviews.author: Charisma Cub

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It works well! I like this! As long as you have a good routine with it, you’re diapers will come out clean everytime! I use half a scoop for pre wash and full scoop for main wash. When the diapers are extra soiled, I use a full scoop for pre wash but that’s not too often that I have too. It’s worth going natural with.
customer_reviews.author: Jessa

customer_reviews.title: Gets the stench out!!
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this detergent to me because my 7mo old kept sucking on her sleep sacks & pajamas at night and they were getting SO stinky. Nothing would get the stench out. She told me it was due to the proteins in her saliva & I needed detergent with enzymes or enzymes separately to get the smell out. I soaked her laundry in hot water with the detergent, then did a regular wash on hot. The smell is completely gone! I am honestly shocked. I assumed the smell was set it because the clothes had gone through a number of washes and dry cycles already. Will definitely continue to use this’n
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well with the right machine settings
customer_reviews.text: I like that this soap doesn't actually smell like soap. It has kept our diapers looking and smelling clean for over 6 months now with only occasional sun bleaching needed. The soap works well on breastfed poop, transitional semi solid, and solid (still shake it out dirst). It cleans diapers and other laundry thoroughly. I ran into contradictory instructions between this soap and the diapers we use. The soap says to wash cold with soap and then run a hot cycle. The diapers say to use soap in the hot cycle, not the first wash. Settling on washing machine settings was a bigger deal than I thought. Every machine is different, so some brand/ model research is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: gtownrunner

customer_reviews.title: Makes Dirty Diapers Look Brand New!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is freaking amazing! I’m new to reusable diapers and was super skeptical to put dirty diapers in my washing machine. My friends recommended Rockin’ Green’s Dirty Diaper. I don’t let the diapers sit more than 2-3 days- I put all of them in my washer and let the cycle run with the lid open. After the cycle stops, I let it sit 5 minutes before closing the lid to finish the cycle and run 2 rinses. They come out brand new every time! If they didn’t, I don’t think I would have been able to stick with reusable diapers. They are way easier to use than I imagined thanks to Rockin’ Green’s Dirty Diaper detergent.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, I still love it after 2 years using it.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this soap on my cloth diapers for 2 years now and I still love it!!! My cloth diapers aren't stained, nor have I needed to "Sun" them EVER. This stuff thoroughly cleans every time. I don't even presoak my poopy diapers anymore, there's no need. You have to follow the directions and do the soak time in the washer, but 2 scoops deliver, just as promised Great value for the money, a bag lasts me almost 3 months( about 11 weeks) and I wash my diapers twice a week. There really is no scent to this soap, but that's fine by me.
customer_reviews.author: Yolonda Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous! Does the job right
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Gets my diapers and wipes clean every time—and I do NOT rinse poopy diapers beforehand (babe is exclusively BF—will obviously have to rinse once on solids). I have had no issues with smell or ammonia build up, or any stains at all. My wash routine is: 2 scoops Dirty Diaper, warm water, largest load possible on high/fast agitation, long cycle. Then I run the whole long cycle 2 more times with Hot water, no soap. Diapers come out clean every time! Very satisfied with this product, & will continue to buy until babe is out of diapers!
customer_reviews.author: tsf

customer_reviews.title: Platinum version contains tea tree oil and gave my son horrible rash like chemical reaction burns
customer_reviews.text: Platinum series Has tea tree oil. Suddenly after switching to it, my son is getting a horrible rash every time he pees. Nothing else changed, and we never had an issue with the Hard Rock we used before. We got a water softener so I figured I didn’t need the Hard Rock anymore and switched to the Platinum, without realizing it had tea tree oil. Regardless of what ingredient is the problem, my son has a horrible rash just like another photo an amazon user uploaded. I guess I’ll try the Classic Rock to see if it helps.
customer_reviews.author: joyello18

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product.I cloth diaper my baby and toddler at the same time and do laundry every day. I add a scoop to my laundry detergent when I was the diapers.It also gets rid of old stains like the ones from food on baby clothing if you pre-soak it with a scoop of this in a tub before washing...It also gets rid of fishy smell from Omega-3 liquid supplement that I give to my kids and that stays on their clothes somehow...
customer_reviews.author: Vlada

customer_reviews.title: Great for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cloth diaper detergent. It seems a little pricey, but you really don’t need much. I strip my diapers with a drop or two of the original blue Dawn every 2-3 months, but otherwise this is all I use. The tea tree oil scent disappears after the wash, so it’s basically unscented. I used their unscented hard rock detergent before the dirty diaper version came out, and it was adequate, but this gets the diapers much cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking at this product, this is the thing you need.
customer_reviews.text: Does an awesome job removing poop from cloth diapers. We've had the most success with deep water wash, hot, with a pre-soak. Check each diaper as you transfer to the dryer. If there are any poop stains left (there usually aren't), put the diaper in a bucket of warm water with a scoop of rockin green and leave it overnight. Next time you're washing diapers (tomorrow?), dump the bucket on top, water and all.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Greatley

customer_reviews.title: Great for seniors clothing
customer_reviews.text: I needed something strong yet gentle to clean and freshen my mother's clothes. As a senior citizen with frequent incontinence issues, the lingering odor was difficult to alleviate. This product really helps with that. Thank you for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Diapers reek & can give chemical burn
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this at all! My husband hated it too. We were using It for our daughter’s cloth diapers. The diapers still have a urine smell and when my daughter peed in her diapers after washing it with this they reek. So gross. None of her other diapers are this way. Just the ones washed with it. Another mom said it gave her baby a chemical burn. Please be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Removes EBF Poo Stains After Several Days
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a "before" picture of this mat, but suffice it to say that we had a big EBF poop explosion on it. While I intended to wash it right away, life happened, and said explosion stayed on the mat untreated for at least 5 days. I didn't really care if it stained, so I washed it the way it was. This detergent got ALL the brown/yellow color out. There's not even a shadow. I'm amazed. I've used Rockin' Green for a few years, but this was my first time using the Dirty Diaper formula...I'm 100% sold on it now.
customer_reviews.author: Afa Maile

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean my cloth diapers and I wouldn't recommend it. While we did not have any skin irritation like most reviewers here, I just wouldn't say this product is worth the high price tag. It's such a small bag and while you don't use much of this product I had a hard time justifying the cost. I use TIDE original powder (DON'T use any other Tide) with a little OxiClean or baking soda and it works wonderfully! Once a month I clothesline "sun bleach" my diapers after doing a really thorough soak + wash and I have never had any problems with ammonia build-up or stains. Seriously Cloth Diaper moms, save yourself the money!
customer_reviews.author: Advanced User

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Detergent
customer_reviews.text: My newborn has peed and pooped on just about everything - His clothes, bassinet sheets, changing pad cover, my clothes.... I've been using this detergent for 3 weeks now and everything comes out smelling fresh and clean. I've also been washing my shirts and nursing bras with his detergent to make sure he doesn't have any skin reactions to my regular detergent.
customer_reviews.author: K Austin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I live this detergent. My little dog sleeps in the bed and she stopped scratching and itching once I started washing sheets with the dirty diaper detergent. Great smell. Love it. Thank you for creating this. You have saved me a lot of money for vet bills.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I’ve found in 13 years for removing odor
customer_reviews.text: This product is a game changer for me! I have a spinal cord injury and suffer from incontinence. I have tried to many different products over 13 years that have left me disappointed. I have never had a product that has worked as great as this with removing odor the FIRST WASH! The product itself doesn’t seem to have any scent to me which is fine. The packaging is small and you may not think you’re getting your money’s worth, but I promise you are you only need to use 2 or 3 tablespoon size scoops. The scooper is included. This is absolutely fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Bad for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: My clothes didn’t smell or look clean. It didn’t even get a simple milk stain out. Update: used this on my lil helper cloth diapers because amazonsent a replacement. Caused the diapers to repel water. I washed them with another solution and they went back to absorbing. Not cloth diaper friendly - not approved by fluff love university. Don’t waste your washes on cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Moody

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed; left a sore-bummed baby!
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other reviewers. I used this on my 18 month old’s diapers, and she now has a terrible rash! She hasn’t had especially sensitive skin compared to my other kids, and I figured that paired with her older age would make her skin strong enough to handle this detergent. It did seem to do well stripping the diapers—which have seen wear over the years with multiple kids—but just too harsh for baby bottoms. Disappointing for sure, especially when it’s such a spendy laundry detergent! I had previously used the Hard Rock Lavendar, and it didn’t cause a rash...but it also didn’t eliminate the ammonia smell from the inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah D

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I did 1 load with this detergent. First, a prewash/soak by using the Speed Wash setting on my top loader with 2 scoops. Next, I did a heavy duty load with 2 scoops with deep fill and extra rinse options on. When I took my cloth diapers out of the washer to put into the dryer, I noticed they still had the residule breatmilk poo and ammonia scents still present. I washed for a THIRD time with 2 scoops and still the diapers came out with a funk to them. Stains were minimal though. I am disappointed in this product as i was very excited to be using a detergent specifically created for cloth diapers. I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Decent detergent. Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of trial and error but we were able to get this to work well for us. We have super hard water 350ppb and have to use more than the recommended, but it works. However, customer service is a joke. I messaged them numerous times for routine help and they have only responded twice and didn't help me resolve ANYTHING. I wound up getting more support from moms on Facebook who DONT work for Rockin Green.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Woods

customer_reviews.title: Causes chemical burns
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for my son’s cloth diapers and it gave him a TERRIBLE chemical burn on the insides of his legs. At the time, I wasn’t sure it was the detergent and I continued using it, unfortunately. His chemical burns got worse as a result. I stopped using this product and switched to Tide original powder and his chemical burns/rash cleared up immediately. I definitely will not be recommending this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works but...
customer_reviews.text: I have to use at least double the amount suggested on the package for washing my cloth diapers. I have a front loader LG and had a good wash routine with my Arm & Hammer detergent but thought I'd give this a try since I prefer un-scented stuff. The first time I tried it with the suggested amounts and it did NOT get them clean. I doubled that amount and it seems to be working now but doesn't make it very cost effective
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: The detergant works really well on stains and smells. However our daughter has sensitive skin and breaks out in a rash from this detergant.
customer_reviews.author: Momma2

customer_reviews.title: Does all it promises
customer_reviews.text: It is very efficient and leave your diapers clean and smelling fresh! I wish it was cheaper, I really do, but it is a product you can completely rely on in your busy mom life and that is worth the price. I will buy again. My daughter used to get big red rashes because I had to use oxi clean baby to remove the poop stains and then learned the enzymes in it were causing the rash. I stopped using a stain remover and just throw the diapers in with this detergent, it's all it needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lea Hossack Bouillon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Cloth Diapers!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing, I've been cloth diapering for about 8 months now due to my baby's sensitive skin. I've been having a problem with stains and my diapers not smelling fresh. I tried this blind and I was not disappointed! My diapers and inserts are bright white again and it did not bleach the patterns, it's amazing. Not only that but they smell clean but they don't smell chemically or like anything other than clean fabric. I will never use anything else for my baby's diapers!
customer_reviews.author: Hailey Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Decreases poop stains but doesn’t get rid of them
customer_reviews.text: I soaked diapers in this, I rubbed it on the stains, I followed all instructions, but it simply doesn’t get the poop stains out. It brings them to a light yellow, so they’re not as bad, but it just doesn’t feel right to put my baby back into a diaper that has light yellow poop stains all over it. I’ll unfortunately go back to using bleach to get the diapers truly clean.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Mugabo

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable for our home!
customer_reviews.text: We have an elderly mom with incontinence issues. Plus, our adopted dog pees in his bed. This laundry soap gets the yucky stuff out without leaving a bunch of residue behind to leave a smell. It should work amazing for baby diapers, too. We use it in conjunction with Angry Orange and Thornell Laundry Odor Eliminator.
customer_reviews.author: Treblediva

customer_reviews.title: So Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This soap works amazing! First use I filled my sink and hand washed a pail of diaper (this was exhausting) but!! It was amazing the amount of gross stuff came out of them!! I was so impressed! I love that it’s an enzymatic wash. I definitely suggest trying even just one time, this will be my go to diaper wash!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Tuley

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: This detergent is great for cloth diapers. I purchased this rift away for my second round of cloth diapering with my second child and don’t regret it. Last time I used regular detergent and an ammonia fighter but I feel this is a far better choice. I still soak and rinse again after washing just to be sure all the detergent is washed out.
customer_reviews.author: PrincessKateTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Overall good detergent
customer_reviews.text: Overall I feel like this detergent does a good job of cleaning the diapers and they have maintained their absorbency better than with a couple of other detergents I tried. However, it seems to work best for me when I use an extra scoop and hang the diapers out in the sun to dry. On the occasions i’ve needed to dry inside due to weather, I’ve noticed there can still be a bit of an odor after washing. Still working on tweaking the washing routine and extra rinsing helps, but was a little disappointed i have to use more than recommended and still run into that issue sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: I add water to powder in dispenser for HE front load machine plus 2 drops tea tree essential oil
customer_reviews.text: Works well! I used it for cloth diapers for years and now for my older special needs daughter’s incontinence. Especially helpful to add a drop or two of tea tree essential oil to each load! I put into the soap dispenser, powder then about 1/2cup water and 2 drops tea tree, wash on sanitize setting and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Dbkdrummer

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Cleans my diapers excellent. I’ve used RG on 3 kids who were/are in CD from birth to potty training with no issues! No funk, no rashes, no issues at all. I swear by RG after trying so many different kinds. Every other kind either caused us problems or didn’t clean well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well, does not get rid of smell
customer_reviews.text: The cleaning powers of this detergent are really good, stains come out really well (even the persistent ones from the previous owner), but they do not get rid of that typical cloth diaper smell. I’ve tried everything, soaking them in vinegar water, adding baking soda, drying in the sun, nothing gets rid of the funk, including this detergent. I really wanted to love cloth diapers but I might have to quit since nothing seems to get them truly clean :(
customer_reviews.author: Marie White

customer_reviews.title: Save your money ... move on
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically for our cloth diapers and let me tell you. Save your money and don’t buy any of these fancy soaps . In reality you can get away with using something more convenient like tide rather than pay this much for soap that ultimately does not do its job. Go on fluff university and see the list of all detergents and why or why not they are not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay at first
customer_reviews.text: This detergent worked well at first, but was not a good long term solution for my laundry. I’ve found other laundry soap that works better and cleaning the clothes and removing any odors.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great product for cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this recently and love it! It doesnt leave a residue and leaves my cloth diapers smelling fresh! I followed product instructions and run a full rinse cycle twice and have never had any issues with burning my two childrens skin (one of which has sensitive skin). Highly recommend this detergent for cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.author: Baylee

customer_reviews.title: Burns skin! Don’t use for diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t use this! Made the skin peel off of my baby’s scrotum and butt. Terrible chemical burn! Not a good product, even when directions are followed. Wound up with an urgent care bill and expensive topical antibiotic ointment.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Mauricio

customer_reviews.title: Causes Ammonia buildup!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this since it’s marketed to be the best for cloth diapers. However, it completely destroyed my diapers. My daughter had a horrible ammonia burn from the detergent buildup. After having this issue, I reached out to several online groups about the issue with this detergent, I found that many people had horrible experiences with this. I have had to strip my diapers, which isn’t good for them, and start with a different soap.
customer_reviews.author: jessrosetta

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT recommend
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe any of the good reviews. This immediately started to burn my daughter’s skin after the first use of this detergent. She’s never been sensitive to detergent and with this calling itself a diaper detergent I thought there wouldn’t be any problems. Wrong ! I now feel so badly for her while I try to determine of all of the diapers are ruined because trying to rinse them out of this detergent doesn’t seem to be possible. I will never buy from this company again!
customer_reviews.author: Kait Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Clean, bright and brand new!
customer_reviews.text: I am not due until May, but bought a ton if vl iij rh diapers to get ready and ordered this. I live that its plant-based and I prepped all of my diapers in 2 days! It doesn't really have a smell, but it cleans well and made them soft again. I air dry them, but it didn't leave a mildew-like smell at all and they're cleaned and ready! I'm loving the variety they have for everyday use too!🙌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Britt H

customer_reviews.title: No more stinky laundry!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I got tired of stinky laundry, and I have sensitive skin so I have to use unscented. This soap works for my baby and our whole family. My laundry is fresh and I hardly had to use any of the soap. One small scoop and your good!
customer_reviews.author: Trisha M Woolley

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: We use this brand for our everyday laundry so I wanted to give this a try when we began cloth diapering. It works great & gets even the toughest stains out of diapers. Will definitely be purchasing again & again.
customer_reviews.author: Vfresta

customer_reviews.title: Did not remove smell on diapers
customer_reviews.text: My diapers still smell lije ammonia when baby pees. I am really dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: alicia

customer_reviews.title: It works on the unspeakable mess that babies can leave in a cloth diaper.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Not one stain on two very dirty, pooped on cloth diapers. I also used it on some very dirty towels my daughter took to camp and they came out looking great and smelling neutral. Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Sleepy

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had people tell me this detergent isn’t great for cloth diapers, but I’ve been using it for 5 months now and I really like it. It seems to clean my diapers well. I use this on a heavy duty, hot, max spin cycle and do that twice and diapers come out smelling fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Erin S

customer_reviews.title: Burned Baby's Skin
customer_reviews.text: I so wanted to love this product. I wish I had read the reviews before I bought it. I LOVE the Hard Rock product of this brand it works great for cloth diapers, but oddly enough the product that says cloth diapers is most definitely NOT cloth diaper safe. Within a few hours my poor son's bum was red and swollen. It looked like he had giant welts. We are on day three and he still hasn't fully healed.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I use this for when my son pees in the bed. It seems to get the pee smell out of the sheets well. I also use it to soak his PJs if the smell is stronger and harder to get out. Good deal and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: RB Jellis

customer_reviews.title: Clothes are soft:)
customer_reviews.text: Just love this stuff! One full scoop and everything comes out clean and I was surprised at how soft the clothes are. I feel like my other detergents we’re leaving funk on the clothes and in the washer so things were coming out dirtier then when they went in. This stuff cleaned all that out and leaves everything nice and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sara prindle

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Works fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Really gets the diapers clean as well as any clothes with poop on them. Tried my normal free and clear detergent, but the diapers were not getting clean and clothes even pretreated ith stain remover we're still poop stained. When I switched to this detergent it really cleaned them.
customer_reviews.author: Carisa Engels

customer_reviews.title: this stuff really works
customer_reviews.text: I am using Dirty Diaper detergent to clean the clothes of my elderly mother, it cleans out stains and the dirty depends smell extremely well so far it is far and away the best product for the job...
customer_reviews.author: jetcopterpilot

customer_reviews.title: Chemical burns!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this ZERO stars, I would. This left my cloth diaper inserts dirty, stinky, and worst of all....major chemical burns on my 3 month old baby! This is infuriating that this product is even available. Sent back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: CMT

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected at all.
customer_reviews.text: Diapers still smell awful and stains are ridiculous even with extra rinses. Wanted to love a green product and move away from a more harsh cloth diaper detergent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Laundry STANK after using this!
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally ordered this instead of my usual order of "Hard Rock Lavender Mint Revival" detergent from the same brand, and my diapers were not at all clean after just the first load. Returning and going back to my usual. We have very hard water so maybe that's why.
customer_reviews.author: Kmom

customer_reviews.title: Gets dirty diapers clean
customer_reviews.text: This is great for diapers, though two whole scoops is waaaay too much. Detergent buildup is a real problem, so check to make sure you don’t still have suds after washing.
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good on my cloth diapers. I have hard water. The diapers haven't been stinking of ammonia (which I've had in the past... ). I like the natural ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Only cloth diaper wash I’ll buy!
customer_reviews.text: If you use cloth diapers or even just want a great clean washing detergent that doesn’t leave any residue then buy this! It’s the only stuff I buy and use for my cloth!
customer_reviews.author: Christina McCormick

customer_reviews.title: This is everything you need for cloth diaper cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I will always always always buy this for my cloth diapers! I was skeptical at first about the ability to clean and remove stains but it really does just that. Over the course of the day I toss my cloth diapers, inserts, and wipes into a bucket, toss in three scoops, and then wash everything at the end of the evening. So far so good! I even used this in my down comforter after a diaper explosion!
customer_reviews.author: Ariane

customer_reviews.title: Gets the funk out!
customer_reviews.text: We have well water, and I had a lot of detergent buildup in my towels, and they stunk. If this doesn't work the first go round, don't give up. Depending on the amount of buildup on your towels or clothes, you may have to repeat the process several times.
customer_reviews.author: TeeKay

customer_reviews.title: Used for dog diaper bands
customer_reviews.text: I use this to wash my dogs belly bands. It works wonders. With one scoop it cleans and deoderizes 4 belly bands and 4 band inserts. They come out white and clean scented. A worth it buy!
customer_reviews.author: Nekko

customer_reviews.title: Did not get diapers clean...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this product because it had such good reviews. I had washed my cloth diapers with normal baby detergent and they came clean each time. My first three times using this product the diapers came out stained each time. Not sure they are actually getting clean. I wouldn’t recommend. I’ll keep using until it’s gone but will not repurchase and just go back to the other detergent.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor E Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: After using this soap for 8 months i can say we love it! I do a cold rinse then hot wash with soap and it gets our cloth diapers clean with one soap cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Wish this came in bigger sizes
customer_reviews.text: Really whitened diapers. I am not a big fan of the scent, but it's not bad. Wish it was more Eco-Friendly packaging. I like to use it with the ammonia pre treatment
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Safe but not as effective as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: My 4 month baby girl has had a number of blowouts. I have pre-soaked and scrubbed the clothes before washing, and poop stains are still showing. Still looking for something that will remove stains completely.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for hard water
customer_reviews.text: We had problems with cloth diapers because we have well water. These seem to do the trick. We also did the presoak before washing. Some we had to wash 2 or 3 times. But it saved most of my cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for stripping diapers and care
customer_reviews.text: Our cloth diapers were getting a bit rough smelling after 2 years and we wanted to freshen them up for our toddler and newborn. This worked so well! We are continuing to use it going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Magee

customer_reviews.title: p.u.
customer_reviews.text: i do NOT like the way this smells. it hits me like sweaty sea water. no good. the cloth diapers are clean though.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Super economical.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have ordered this. The first time lasted us a couple days short of FIVE months. And we have a top loader. So if you have a front loader, this could easily last 10 months with a front loader. I use it on our pocket diapers and we have mostly microfiber inserts and I LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy:(
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t smell bad and may work of for new diapers but didn’t do what it said. Rocking green with funk rock is better but mighty bubbles from go vira is where it’s at! Wish I could have gotten my money back on this.
customer_reviews.author: laura marsh

customer_reviews.title: Try it, thank me later.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a God send. It cleans diapers with poop residue! No bad smells, no endless scrubbing! Just get most the poop out, and toss them in with 2 scoops. It's almost magic. A must have for anyone cloth diapering.
customer_reviews.author: undertheboardwalk

customer_reviews.title: Good powder diaper soap
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another diaper soap no longer available. Works just as well as the soap we used with our first two children so we are happy to have found a replacement soap. Good for hard water, rinses well.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great for set in stains!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing!!! It gets out set in stains which even includes poop. I am very impressed and will be buying again!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Mae Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: This did not work well for me. I changed products after using only half the bag. I can use these on pee diapers for a daily wash only. I felt like it was a waste of water to wash only about 5 diapers daily instead of every 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Indigenous

customer_reviews.title: Which hard water additive would be recommended to use with Rockin Green
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. I have hard water and was hoping this would cut it since it has enzymes. I guess if it needed a hard water detergent along with it. Just not sure which one Rockin Green would recommend. Plus my child has super sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Schmit

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great! My cloth diapers are so fresh and so clean, clean! The old stains have really lightened up and they smell good, not like chemicals. This is my go to product to keep my diapers nice and clean. Thanks Bill!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: 18 months of repeat purchases, best cloth diaper soap!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this soap for my cloth diapers for 18 months. I do laundry 1-2x per week and I use 1-2 scoops each load depending on the size, not an he washer. NO RASHES, wonderful scent, only have to do an ammonia soak once every few months. I buy a bag every 2-3 months. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this soap for all your cloth diapering, and cloth feminine hygiene needs
customer_reviews.author: Leana Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Works okay
customer_reviews.text: I did have to re strip my diapers while using this product, could be due to my hard water. Bought the hardwater soap to give a fair try
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Only thing I don't like is the closure. It's ziplock and the whole thing came unglued so it couldn't be resealed.
customer_reviews.author: TiffyRose

customer_reviews.title: Best detergent for cloth diapers- worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We use this detergent with cloth diapers and wipes and it works like a charm! It was a must for years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Missy McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only diaper wash that doesn’t break out my sons butt. I do have to strip the diaper every month or it’ll hold an awful odor.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron holmes

customer_reviews.title: No smelly diapers!
customer_reviews.text: This detergent is great! It takes all the smell out of the diapers and inserts. I haven’t had to strip diapers after using this product either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in combination with the ammonia bounce for cloth diapers and it really does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Mickelson

customer_reviews.title: Left a fish smell
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, sounds great but was not getting my diapers clean. They had a funky smell after getting wet. They smelled fishy. Soft water here. I am going back to tide
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Superior Diaper Detergent
customer_reviews.text: I have rated this product before and nothing has changed in my opinion. I wear cloth diapers for medical reasons and this detergent is “Superior” in cleaning cloth diapers! Along with detergent I also use the “Funk Rock” detergent to prevent and rid out ammonia smells in the diapers. Highly recommend this product which does its job in cleaning cloth diapers. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Diapered Mike 58

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Pulled shadowing, stains, and ammonia smell out of my cloth diapers the first wash! It also takes a very small amount so it lasts a few months with a 3-4 day a week wash routine. I’m glad I switched to this detergent. It exceeded my expectations by far!
customer_reviews.author: debbie barton

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cloth diapers! Chemical burns, ammonia, etc..
customer_reviews.text: This detergent made for an overall horrible experience. It caused chemical burns on my baby's bottom and also did a terrible job cleaning the diapers which led to ammonia build up and the most atrocious smell. We have since stripped our diapers and have been pleased just using Tide! It is unfortunate that this detergent is marketed for cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Plummer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes our diapers WHITE and clean! Gets stains out of clothes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Puff

customer_reviews.title: Great for cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.text: We used cloth diapers on all three of our kids and only used rockin green detergent for cleaning our diapers, it's a bit pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Not , just for diapers!!
customer_reviews.text: I definitely recommend this detergent! Especially if you have any set in stains, this is definitely not just for diapers! I used it on some old dish towels that had set in stains for years, it removed just about all the stains! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: fishers54

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My only qualm is that it doesn't come in bulk size. It cleans wonderfully without making your clothing smell like a perfume bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda W.

customer_reviews.title: Smells great
customer_reviews.text: Used on my diapers this morning. Smelled much better after coming out of the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: sonnenba

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Cloth Diapers
customer_reviews.text: Works great, wish it did more for stains but nothing the Sun can't fix. 😉
customer_reviews.author: HappyHunter

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has helped ya get stains out of our kids school clothes. We use it weekly and keeps school clothes looking good.
customer_reviews.author: ScoobaSteve

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: Bought for cloth diapers then found out it’s not a recommended soap for cloth
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my little ones cloth diapers. Also purchased a second hand kinderpac carrier that came to me musty and this was wonderful at getting it cleaned up and getting rid of the musty odor
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K Russell

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for cleaning diapers! Followed the routine as instructed. I use this only on the main wash. Gets my diapers looking extra white.
customer_reviews.author: Flochoa

product_meta.title: Rockin' Green Platinum Series Dirty Diaper Powdered Laundry Detergent, 45 oz. - All Natural, Biodegradable, and Eco-Friendly
feature_bullets: DIRTY DIAPER DETERGENT - Make sure your baby's cloth diapers are clean and safe with our proven laundry detergent that is strong enough for the tough stains and gentle enough for baby's skin.

NATURAL CLOTH DIAPER DETERGENT - This detergent is vegan and cruelty free and doesn't rely on dyes and harmful chemicals like SLS, SLES, phosphates, parabens and artificial fragrances. All Rockin' Green products are proudly made in the USA!
REMOVES EVEN STUBBORN STAINS - Our cloth diaper detergent uses a broad spectrum enzyme blend to remove stains from fat, protein and starch to deep clean and remove odors and biological residue.
IDEAL FOR ALL WASHING MACHINES - Wash up to 90 loads in front-load machines or 45 loads in top-load machines, our diaper detergent is HE compatible and easy to use.

NO CHEMICAL SMELL - Enjoy our tea tree oil scent in our natural cloth diaper detergent. Our product is gentle on baby's skin and naturally protects fibers of cloth diapers, to ensure they last longer.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars550 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
